bibl.title: William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham v. David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell. Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Justice Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit, Territory of Washington

body.p: I hereby certify that in persuance of a certain committment in and out of Justice John T. Mason Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit Territory of Washington on the day of September AD 1887, I took into my charge in a certain action in which the Territory of Washington was plaintiff and William Tinkham was Defendant. I took into my charge and custody the said William Tinkham and proceeded with said Tinkham to the County Jail of King County while when he was to be committed, and that in the city of Seattle is said King County while said Tinkham was in my custody. A Writ of Habeas Corpus in and out of the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of the Territory of Washington, commanding me to have and produce the body of said Tinkham before the Honorable R.A. Jones, Chief of Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory and Judge of said 3rd Judicial District was on one and that in obedience to said Writ of Habeas Corpus I produced the said Tinkham in Court, and in pursuance of the an order of the Judge providing a copy of which is here attached, said Tinkham was discharged and released from my custody.
In the Justice Court of Mt Vernon Precinct County of Skatig Territory of Was
Territory of Wash vs William Tinkham
John T. Mason Justice of the Peace
